intro: Otostegia olgae, commonly known as the African snowdrop, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Otostegia olgae is known for its short growing season, blooming in late winter or early spring. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are evergreen, providing a lush backdrop to its delicate blossoms.
